snippet.title: ¿Hubo un acuerdo entre EE.UU. y Perón para refugiar nazis en Argentina?
snippet.description:
* (CNNEspanol.com) – Estados Unidos y otros países occidentales hicieron un acuerdo para permitir la fuga de nazis a Argentina, según Uki Goñi, autor del best-seller "La Autentica Odessa", en una entrevista con CNN en Español. Según él historiador y...
http://cnnespanol.cnn.com/2012/07/25/hubo-un-acuerdo-entre-ee-uu-y-peron-para-refugiar-nazis-en-argentina/

snippet.title: Your e-mails: London bombings
snippet.description:
* CNN.com asked users to share their thoughts about how the London bombings have affected them. Here is a sampling from the responses, some of which have been edited:
http://www.cnn.com/2005/WORLD/europe/07/07/feedback.london/index.html

snippet.title: Soaps to brighten Poland's Euro image
snippet.description:
* Television soap stars are being asked to brighten the European Union's image -- to boost support for membership in Poland.
http://www.cnn.com/2001/WORLD/europe/02/16/poland.eu/index.html

snippet.title: Sarah Outen: Around the world on two boats and a bike
snippet.description:
* I am attempting to journey from London to London via the world, using just a rowing boat, a bike and a kayak. I write from Japan -- where I am eight months and 11000 miles in to this 2.5 year expedition, having cycled and kayaked all the way here.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/12/19/travel/sarah-outen-around-globe/index.html

snippet.title: 10 under-the-radar islands
snippet.description:
* Tried-and-true island favorites such as St. Barths and Capri have long been wooing fashionable travelers. But these days, the new prestige in globetrotting lies in exploring far-flung destinations the masses have yet to invade. Even better: a vacation spot so exotic that no one has even heard of it.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/11/01/travel/new-luxury-islands/index.html

snippet.title: Prince Harry and the media: Your views
snippet.description:
* News that Britain's Prince Harry had been deployed to Afghanistan since December was kept secret by many news outlets for security reasons. A Web site broke the news blackout Thursday. We have been appealing for your views on the news blackout. The following are a selection of your replies:
http://www.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/asiapcf/02/29/yourviews.harry/index.html

snippet.title: Your e-mails: France's new premier
snippet.description:
* France's new president, Nicolas Sarkozy, was sworn in, Wednesday, amid a grand ceremony at the Elysee Palace.
http://www.cnn.com/2007/WORLD/europe/05/16/yourview.france/index.html

snippet.title: Your e-mails: Gordon Brown
snippet.description:
* He is the longest-serving chancellor of the exchequer the UK has had in 200 years, and he was Tony Blair's right-hand man during the last three election wins for the Labour party, but is Gordon Brown the best man to take over as British prime minister?
http://www.cnn.com/2007/WORLD/europe/05/11/yourviews.brown/index.html

snippet.title: Your e-mails: Blair to stand down
snippet.description:
* Having won three successive elections, and served as the British Prime Minister for the last 10 years, Tony Blair is bringing an end to his time in office.
http://www.cnn.com/2007/WORLD/europe/05/10/blair.yourviews/index.html

snippet.title: CNN audience reacts to Mumbai blasts
snippet.description:
* CNN viewers and readers from around the world have been appalled at Tuesday's deadly attacks on commuter trains and stations in the Indian financial capital of Mumbai.
http://www.cnn.com/2006/WORLD/asiapcf/07/11/mumbaiblast.emailcomments/index.html
